text:
Your training set is \( D = \{(x^{(1)}, y^{(1)}), ..., (x^{(m)}, y^{(m)})\} \). Assume that your model for the data is $$y^{(i)} \sim \text{Laplace}(\theta^Tx^{(i)}, 1) .$$ The probability density function of the Laplace distribution with mean \(\mu\) and scale parameter \(b\) is $$f(x|\mu,b) = \frac{1}{2b}\text{exp}(-\frac{-|x-\mu|}{b}).$$
Write down the formula for the likelihood of the training set \(D\).
correctAnswer: The likelihood of the training set is the product of the probabilities of the \(y^{(i)}\)s given the \(x^{(i)}\)s: $$L_\theta(y|x) = \prod_{i=1}^{m}f(y|\theta^Tx^{(i)}, 1) = \prod_{i=1}^{m}\bigg( \frac{1}{2}\text{exp}(-|\theta^Tx^{(i)} - y^{(i)}|) \bigg).$$
